description: Nearest integer to R(n) - pi(n), where R(x) is the Riemann prime counting function.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
H. J. Smith, XPCalc - Extra Precision Floating-Point Calculator.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Riemann Prime Counting Function
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
extensions: Corrected 6 terms, a(2), a(7), a(10), a(13), a(20) and a(48). Each was made 1 larger. Also gave an example for a(13) and a program for computing a(n). - _Harry J. Smith_, Dec 31 2008
